blocks.name: cnelbr
blocks.content: Extend wff notation to include the 'not elemet of' relation.

blocks.name: diff.cnelbr.s
diff.cnelbr.c
diff.cnelbr.w
df-nelbr
blocks.content: Define negated membership as binary relation. Analogous to ~ df-eprel (the epsilon relation). (Contributed by AV, 26-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: dfnelbr2
blocks.content: Alternate definition of the negated membership as binary relation. (Proposed by BJ, 27-Dec-2021.) (Contributed by AV, 27-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm dfnelbr2() {
  |- wceq(cnelbr, cdif(cxp(universe, universe), cep))
} = {
  3eqtr4ri(cnelbr, cdif(cxp(universe, universe), cep), cdif(copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe))), copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))))
  difopab(hs0, hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  difeq12i(cxp(universe, universe), cep, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe))), copab(hs0, hs1, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  df-xp(hs0, hs1, universe, universe)
  df-eprel(hs0, hs1)
  eqtri(cnelbr, copab(hs0, hs1, wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))), copab(hs0, hs1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  df-nelbr(hs0, hs1)
  opabbii(hs0, hs1, wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))))
  biantrur(wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(cv(hs0), universe), wcel(cv(hs1), universe))
  vex(hs0)
  vex(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(universe)
  diff.hs1.c(universe)
}

blocks.name: nelbr
blocks.content: The binary relation of a set not being a member of another set. (Contributed by AV, 26-Dec-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm nelbr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wb(wbr(c0, cnelbr, c2), wn(wcel(c0, c2))))
} = {
  brabga(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2, c3, cnelbr, wn(wcel(c0, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))))
  notbid(wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wcel(c0, c2))
  eleq12(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1), c2)
  df-nelbr(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(wn(wcel(c0, c2)))
  diff.hs1.w(wn(wcel(c0, c2)))
}

  notbid((hs0 = c0 âˆ§ hs1 = c2), hs0 âˆˆ hs1, c0 âˆˆ c2)
  eleq12(hs0, c0, hs1, c2)
  df-nelbr(hs0, hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.w(Â¬ c0 âˆˆ c2)
  diff.hs1.w(Â¬ c0 âˆˆ c2)
}

blocks.name: nelbrim
blocks.content: If a set is related to another set by the negated membership relation, then it is not a member of the other set. The other direction of the implication is not generally true, because if ` A ` is a proper class, then ` -. A e. B ` would be true, but not ` A e// B ` . (Contributed by AV, 26-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: nelbrnel
blocks.content: A set is related to another set by the negated membership relation iff it is not a member of the other set. (Contributed by AV, 26-Dec-2021.)

blocks.name: nelbrnelim
blocks.content: If a set is related to another set by the negated membership relation, then it is not a member of the other set. (Contributed by AV, 26-Dec-2021.)
